speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE IV. A plain in Denmark.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter FORTINBRAS, a Captain, and Soldiers, marching

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Go, captain, from me greet the Danish king;

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Tell him that, by his licence, Fortinbras

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Craves the conveyance of a promised march

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Over his kingdom. You know the rendezvous.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: If that his majesty would aught with us,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: We shall express our duty in his eye;

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: And let him know so.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: I will do't, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Go softly on.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Exeunt FORTINBRAS and Soldiers

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET, ROSENCRANTZ, GUILDENSTERN, and others

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good sir, whose powers are these?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: They are of Norway, sir.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How purposed, sir, I pray you?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Against some part of Poland.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Who commands them, sir?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: The nephews to old Norway, Fortinbras.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Goes it against the main of Poland, sir,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Or for some frontier?

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Truly to speak, and with no addition,

speaker: Captain
text_entry: We go to gain a little patch of ground

speaker: Captain
text_entry: That hath in it no profit but the name.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: To pay five ducats, five, I would not farm it;

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Nor will it yield to Norway or the Pole

speaker: Captain
text_entry: A ranker rate, should it be sold in fee.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, then the Polack never will defend it.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Yes, it is already garrison'd.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Two thousand souls and twenty thousand ducats

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Will not debate the question of this straw:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This is the imposthume of much wealth and peace,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That inward breaks, and shows no cause without

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why the man dies. I humbly thank you, sir.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: God be wi' you, sir.

speaker: Captain
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
text_entry: Wilt please you go, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll be with you straight go a little before.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exeunt all except HAMLET

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How all occasions do inform against me,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And spur my dull revenge! What is a man,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If his chief good and market of his time

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Be but to sleep and feed? a beast, no more.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sure, he that made us with such large discourse,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Looking before and after, gave us not

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That capability and god-like reason

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To fust in us unused. Now, whether it be

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Bestial oblivion, or some craven scruple

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of thinking too precisely on the event,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A thought which, quarter'd, hath but one part wisdom

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And ever three parts coward, I do not know

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why yet I live to say 'This thing's to do;'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sith I have cause and will and strength and means

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To do't. Examples gross as earth exhort me:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Witness this army of such mass and charge

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Led by a delicate and tender prince,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whose spirit with divine ambition puff'd

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Makes mouths at the invisible event,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exposing what is mortal and unsure

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To all that fortune, death and danger dare,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Even for an egg-shell. Rightly to be great

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is not to stir without great argument,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But greatly to find quarrel in a straw

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When honour's at the stake. How stand I then,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That have a father kill'd, a mother stain'd,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Excitements of my reason and my blood,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And let all sleep? while, to my shame, I see

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The imminent death of twenty thousand men,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That, for a fantasy and trick of fame,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Go to their graves like beds, fight for a plot

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Whereon the numbers cannot try the cause,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Which is not tomb enough and continent

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To hide the slain? O, from this time forth,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My thoughts be bloody, or be nothing worth!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit
